author: metachris_
content: Fyi - Lido and other staking pools requested a way to query recently proposed headers from mev-boost (see also https://github.com/flashbots/mev-boost/issues/120)

author: jgm
content: Having to query lots of relays to obtain that information, and having the relays persist information like that, seems a bit painful.  Could there not be something simpler, like a requirement to use `ExtraData` to identify the builder, instead?

author: tersec
content: kind of kludgy. Not sure what `ExtraData` should be for, but if people want something in any reliable/consistent way, it's very much a stopgap

author: jgm
content: A better alternative would be for the relays to push out a signed attestation that it created the block, but then we need a network to transport it and somewhere to store it.  None of which is very pretty.

author: tersec
content:
Sure, and the CL specs are tightly enough constructed that there aren't a lot of random places to wedge this information that are much better, so it becomes a question of whether one wants MEV to live sort of in the shadows, as, well, kind of a conceptual sidecar, or introduce it more formally as part Ethereum.

My inclination is to do the former, actually, pending danksharding/PBS becoming more standardized. Yes, people need something now, so MEV can't wait for Eth L1 PBS, but it's a solid enough roadmap item it might be worth skulking around a bit longer.

author: lightclient
content:
Just released `v0.1` of the builder spec! The main two changes to be aware of is the clarified signing logic (thanks <@539495253418180618>) and allowing batches validator registrations to be posted (thanks <@388610194608750595>):
https://github.com/ethereum/builder-specs/releases/tag/v0.1.0

author: lightclient
content:
I also put together a simple doc to track all of the different versions. Everyone should have access to editing it, so if you are working on this for a CL team it would be great to list your tracking commit / PR so that as things come together we can have people run these on testnets. It would also be great if builder / relay maintainers could list their relevant code sources and docs so people can spin those up on testnets. 

Please note that I did cut a v0.0.0 of mergemock, but it targets the v0.0.0 release of the builder api. I will work on integrating the v0.1.0 changes now. I'll post an update here when they are complete, but in the mean time here is the interop doc: 
https://notes.ethereum.org/@lightclient/BJ2FLuL89
